<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 211, 875, 291]]<|/det|>
The student places two pins \(\mathsf{P}_1\) and \(\mathsf{P}_2\) on the line \(\mathbf{FE}\), placing one pin close to \(\mathbf{E}\). She observes the images of \(\mathsf{P}_1\) and \(\mathsf{P}_2\) through side \(\mathbf{CD}\) of the block so that the images of \(\mathsf{P}_1\) and \(\mathsf{P}_2\) appear one behind the other. She places two pins \(\mathsf{P}_3\) and \(\mathsf{P}_4\) between her eye and the block so that \(\mathsf{P}_3\) and \(\mathsf{P}_4\), and the images of \(\mathsf{P}_1\) and \(\mathsf{P}_2\) seen through the block, appear one behind the other.

Here is a list of some apparatus. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 120, 272, 135]]<|/det|> ammeter <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 152, 284, 166]]<|/det|> barometer <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 184, 256, 198]]<|/det|> beaker <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 215, 348, 229]]<|/det|> electronic balance <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 246, 293, 260]]<|/det|> manometer <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 277, 355, 291]]<|/det|> measuring cylinder <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 308, 282, 322]]<|/det|> metre rule <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 339, 443, 353]]<|/det|> newtonmeter (spring balance) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 370, 282, 384]]<|/det|> stopwatch <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 401, 312, 415]]<|/det|> tape measure <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 432, 304, 446]]<|/det|> thermometer <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 463, 275, 477]]<|/det|> voltmeter <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 492, 873, 523]]<|/det|> Complete Table 5.1 by inserting the name of one piece of apparatus from the list that is the most suitable for measuring each quantity described. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 570, 839, 772]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 816, 107]]<|/det|>
The IGCSE class is carrying out a lens experiment. This involves using an illuminated object, a screen and a lens.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 875, 153]]<|/det|>
Firstly, the distance between the illuminated object and the lens is measured with a metre rule. Next, a clearly focused image is obtained on the screen.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 166, 180, 185]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 166, 875, 199]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 304, 178, 323]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 304, 846, 323]]<|/det|>
